question: Which of the following factors affect the electronic conductance of an electrolytic solution?
option1: the nature of the electrolyte added
option2: size of the ions produced and their solvation
option3: the nature of the solvent and its viscosity
explanation: The conductance of electricity by ions present in the solutions is called electrolytic or ionic conductance. The conductivity of electrolytic (ionic) solutions depends on: (i) the nature of the electrolyte added (ii) size of the ions produced and their solvation (iii) the nature of the solvent and its viscosity (iv) concentration of the electrolyte (v) temperature (it increases with the increase of temperature).
